Class PreferencesDataAccess

java.lang.Object
ch.supsi.dataaccess.preferences.PreferencesDataAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
PreferencesDataAccessInterface
public class PreferencesDataAccess extends Object implements PreferencesDataAccessInterface
Provides access to user preferences, including loading, saving, and creating default preferences. This class handles preferences stored in the user's filesystem and ensures that they are available for the application runtime. It uses a singleton pattern to guarantee a single instance.

      Creates a user preferences file with the default preferences.
      Parameters:

      Loads the default user preferences from the properties file.
      Returns:
      a Properties object containing the default preferences
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while loading the default preferences

      Returns:
      an InputStream for the resource

    • loadPreferences

      private Properties loadPreferences(Path path) throws IOException
      Loads and returns the preferences from the specified file path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the preferences file
      Returns:
      a Properties object containing the loaded preferences
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while loading the preferences

    • getPreferences

      public Properties getPreferences()
      Retrieves the user's preferences. If no preferences file exists, a new one is created with default preferences.
      Specified by:
      getPreferences in interface PreferencesDataAccessInterface
      Returns:
      a Properties object containing the user's preferences

    • storePreference

      public boolean storePreference(Map.Entry<String,String> preference) throws IOException
      Stores a preference in the user preferences file. Updates a copy of the user preferences and writes it to the filesystem.
      Specified by:
      storePreference in interface PreferencesDataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      preference - a key-value pair representing the preference to be stored
      Returns:
      true if the operation succeeds, false false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while storing the preference
